meanings.definition: Cause (someone) to undergo severe mental or emotional distress.
meanings.sent1: The scary movie was so traumatizing that I couldn't sleep at night.
meanings.sent2: The car accident was traumatizing for everyone involved.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a talking dog may be traumatizing to some, but it's just a cartoon!
meanings.sent4: The news of the sudden job loss was like a traumatizing thunderstorm in her otherwise peaceful life.
meanings.sent5: The image of the burning building was so traumatizing that it stayed in my mind for days.

meanings.definition: Subject to lasting shock as a result of an emotionally disturbing experience.
meanings.sent1: The haunted house was so traumatizing that I had nightmares for weeks.
meanings.sent2: The war veteran still carries the traumatizing memories of the battlefield.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a clown riding a unicycle may be traumatizing to some, but it's just a circus act!
meanings.sent4: The breakup was a traumatizing earthquake that shook her world.
meanings.sent5: The sound of the gunshot was so traumatizing that it echoed in his ears for years.
